title: Dashcam captures moment car flips and crashes while overtaking on Greenhill Rd
text:
Dashcam footage has captured the heart-stopping moment a car flipped and crashed into oncoming traffic on an Adelaide Hills road.

Emergency services were called to a three-car crash on Greenhill Rd near Yarrabee Rd, Greenhill, just after 10.15am on Thursday, when two vehicles rolled.

Dashcam from one of the vehicles involved showed a yellow Audi in the opposing lane trying to overtake a white Toyota.

But it clipped and flipped before crashing into a red Honda.

WATCH: Dashcam has captured the heart-stopping moment a car flips into the path of another vehicle in the Adelaide Hills. MORE in #9NewsAt6 pic.twitter.com/Njcjgt0T42 — Nine News Adelaide (@9NewsAdel) October 24, 2019

The Toyota driver, a 56-year-old man Parafield Gardens, was taken to Royal Adelaide Hospital with minor injuries while the Honda driver, a 48-year-old Firle man, was not injured.

The Audi driver, a 26-year-old Carey Gully man, who also had minor injuries is expected to be reported for traffic offences.

Greenhill Rd was closed for two hours while all cars were towed from the scene.

Meanwhile, a motorcyclist has been flown to hospital after crashing into a car at Chain of Ponds.

The man in his 30s fractured his leg in the collision on Tippett Rd near Newman Rd just after 11am on Thursday.

The driver was not hurt.
description: Dashcam footage has captured the heart-stopping moment a car flipped and crashed into oncoming traffic on an Adelaide Hills road. Miraculously there were no serious injuries.
